biography.text:
MORSTAN, Mary

Spy for the Socialist Party in London in the third quarter of the nineteenth century.

Mary Morstan was the daughter of captain Arthur Morstan. After his death she became involved with the Socialist Party, who enlisted her as a spy. In 1889 she married doctor John Watson to get close to royal private detective Sherlock Holmes. She tragically died when Holmes shot her to protect the queen from Morstan’s assassination attempt. class="lit">LITERATUUR: Centrale Bond van Ziekenfondsen 1913-1938.
